name: JW Marriott Hotel Grand Rapids

reviews.text: I was blown away by this hotel. Unreal. It is simply amazing. I kept asking myself why is this in Grand Rapids? That comment is not meant to be condescending at all rather I just don't know how this huge hotel (23 floors) stays in business. It is next to the huge Amway hotel and on the other side is the Courtyard Marriott hotel. Does Grand Rapids draw that many people? Also, I travel a lot and would love to have this caliber hotel say in Chicago, Orlando, or even nearby Detroit!
reviews.title: Grand Rapids splendor
Love this hotel! OUTSTANDING Service!
reviews.text: I stay in hotels 70+ nights a year and this is by far in the top 3 of the best hotels I have stayed at.
Every detail has been looked after from the staff to the interior design to the rooms.
reviews.title: The Best Grand Rapids Has To Offer

reviews.text: POSITIVES:
reviews.title: Like a NYC or LA hotel but at half price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 - the staff is amazing. They all were so accomodating and never had a sense of attitude (see W Hotels). I never felt this place to hip for me or out of place yet it was totally modern and eclectic in nature. They made me feel welcome and a valued guest.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: What a great hotel!! especially for a smaller town....I stayed here on a trip to grand rapids for buisness and it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were CLEAN, COMFORTABLE and BEAUTIFUL! The bathroom was large with a seperate shower and bath. The bed was SOOO comfy!! I definatly will be staying here again!!! THe room service was the one thing that i would pass up the next time...(food was cold)
reviews.title: Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!

reviews.text: After a weary road trip and two prior bad experiences with hotels in Traverse City and Mackinaw City, we stopped at the Marriott in Grand Rapids. It was an oasis for comfort-starved travelers.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Grand Rapids

reviews.text: Not only is the hotel beautiful and contemporary, our room was fitted with all the amenities... flat screen tv, shower, bath, tech board that enables you to use the tv as a monitor, frosted glasses, complementary bottled water, clean pool, hot tub, bar, restaurants, etc. The air quality was good and the beds felt new.
reviews.title: Nice Location, Mostly Arrogant Service

likes.disliked: — The service--front desk, management, bell boy, etc.

reviews.text: The reservationist at the front desk was extremely helpful and provided us with a map and directions to an excellent restaurant that served vegetarian dishes. The food in the hotel's restaurant is good, particularly if you like fresh ingredients and luxury items like artisan cheeses. The service was good all around. The people made us feel welcome even though we looked like hobos when we arrived.
reviews.title: This sleek and chic hotel is easily the best in Grand Rapids!

reviews.text: If I ever have to return to Grand Rapids, I will definitely stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here after 8 nights at several different Hilton properties. This was an amazing step up from any of them! The staff was excellent, including the valet attendants, the front desk staff, and everyone in the concierge lounge.
reviews.title: Georgeous hotel with awesome service!!

reviews.text: The hotel is brand new, so everything sparkles. We had a room on the 23rd floor overlooking the river. There was an large LCD TV, a large work desk with connections for not only power and internet, but also direct connections to hook my laptop up to the TV. Also sound connections to play music through the stereo TV speakers and the speaker in the bathroom. That was a nice touch while my wife was soaking in the beatiful tub. The bathroom overall was great, with a large tub and separate shower.
reviews.title: Caution..problems at Hotel.

likes.disliked: — problems without sorry or offer to conpensate

reviews.text: The concierge lounge serves great snacks in the evening (almost enough for dinner) and a large breakfast variety. The lounge is open on weekends - a real rarity these days.
reviews.title: Great (mostly) service in a luxurious atmosphere!

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, the service is excellent, and the location is great. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Company Holiday Party

likes.liked: — Modern facilities, business set up, ipod hook ups,

reviews.text: This was a girls night out. The hotel was beautiful, the registration went smooth. However, after being in the room we noticed that there was a broken glass on the floor next to the bed. Lots of large pieces with sharp points. Fortunately we didn't have any kids with us. The next morning after taking a shower, while drying off I heard a noise, and out came a very black stinky sledge (like sewer back up) in the bathroom sink and splattered all over stuff. At check out we told the people (2) at the front desk about the glass, they said thanks for letting them know. Then we told them about the bathroom incident (which was still in the sink) and they said they would contact maintenance. Then, they asked us if other than that, was our stay okay?.....No sorry for the problems, or offer on a discount rate, or another night stay. I was under the impression that JW Marriott Hotels were the elite, the best in the world. I'm not convinced. My friend paid for the room, so I kept my mouth shut about getting any adjustment or a future stay. However, this is one way I can let travelers know that they might want to stay at a neighboring hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel a lot for work and for pleasure. We were pleasantly shocked by the JW in Grand Rapids. Every amenity we needed, including a great restaurant and bar and a good gym. A gorgeous property with well-trained staff, but without the stuffiness of other good hotels on bar with its class. We went for a weekend getaway and it did not disappoint. Gorgeous views, convenient location within walking distance of good restaurants and entertainment. A fabulous experience.
reviews.title: A wonderful urban getaway in a nice, small city

likes.liked: — chic style, authentic hospitality and customer service

reviews.text: Wow! The JW Marriott was a very pleasant surprise!
reviews.title: Posh, Swanky and Enjoyable!

likes.disliked: — Difficult to locate based on wrong address on their website

reviews.text: I traveled to Grand Rapids on business and a friend suggested I stay at the JW overnight. I decided to check it out, and I was very impressed. Here are a few of my observations:
reviews.title: top notch

likes.disliked: — having to leave for family emergency

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: -A little difficult to find (address listed on their website was incorrect). The hotel is located on a street called Louis Promenade so be sure to include the full street name in your online map and or GPS system.
reviews.title: Loved the JW Marriott GRand Rapids!

likes.liked: — great room design.. cool TV...great desk chair!

description: The JW Marriott Grand Rapids is everything you would expect and nothing you could have imagined. Situated in the heart of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, the JW Marriott Grand Rapids is meticulously designed for both business and pleasure. As the first JW Marriott hotel in the Midwest, the hotel offers 337 well-appointed, smoke-free rooms and suites on 23 posh floors. Each of which is outfitted with atypical amenities like a 37" plasma TV, as well as numerous other uncommon personal luxuries. From shareholder's meetings to lavish wedding receptions to intimate weekend getaways to The Spa, the JW raises the bar. In luxury. In service. In dining. In everything.
